name: brink
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 the point where a new or different situation is about to begin: Extreme stress had driven him to the brink of a nervous breakdown. Scientists are on the brink of (= extremely close to) a major new discovery.
literary the edge of a cliff or other high area: She was standing right on the brink of the gorge.
More examplesFewer examplesThese countries are on the brink of a disastrous famine.Many companies are on the brink of ruin.Negotiations between the two countries are on the brink of collapse.What we are seeing now is a country teetering on the brink of civil war.Not long ago the river otter was on the brink of extinction.
